Paragraph:  For the midsize A350 XWB , a wide-body jet , France and Germany will each have 35 percent of the workload , 20 percent will go to Britain and 10 percent to Spain , the company said .

* Germany

* Spain

| Person | Nationality | Whether the Person has the Nationality |
| --- | --- | --- |
| France | France | Yes |
| Germany | Germany | Yes |
| Britain | Britain | Yes |
| Spain | Spain | Yes |

Note: In this case, the "Persons" refer to the countries where the companies involved in the workload distribution of the A350 XWB are based.

location contains.content:
Please analyze the following paragraph to determine the hierarchical relationship between two geographical locations mentioned. Specifically, identify which location is broader and encompasses the other, more specific location.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Broader Location', 'Specific Location', 'Whether the Broader Location contains the Specific Location']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

Paragraph:  For the midsize A350 XWB , a wide-body jet , France and Germany will each have 35 percent of the workload , 20 percent will go to Britain and 10 percent to Spain , the company said . 

Let's think step by step.

The paragraph mentions two broader geographical locations, France and Germany, which each have 35 percent of the workload for the A350 XWB. The A350 XWB is a specific type of wide-body jet, so France and Germany are both broader locations that encompass the work being done on the A350 XWB.

The paragraph also mentions Britain and Spain, which have 20 percent and 10 percent of the workload, respectively. Since Britain and Spain are also mentioned as separate from France and Germany, we can infer that they are more specific locations that are encompassed within the broader locations of France and Germany.

Therefore, the valid relationships between the geographical locations mentioned in the paragraph are as follows:

| Broader Location | Specific Location | Whether the Broader Location contains the Specific Location |
| --- | --- | --- |
| France | A350 XWB | Yes |
| Germany | A350 XWB | Yes |
| France | Britain | Yes |
| Germany | Britain | Yes |
| France | Spain | Yes |
| Germany | Spain | Yes |

Note that the A350 XWB is a specific location in the sense that it is a particular type of wide-body jet, but it is not a geographical location. Therefore, it does not make sense to include it in the "Broader Location" column of the table.
